reviews.text: smells like victory in the morning pushing the damp sheets and heaving like a good un. rog my mate reckins it keeps you up longer if u now what i mean?

Perfect beer for breakfast and early mornings (especially after a night of drinking). Smooth as a babyâs bottom, goes down as easily as water, the foam is thick, creamy and satisfying. The aroma is slightly bitter but hides a slight whiff of burnt almonds and brown sugar. The taste is unmatched, best served with a bowl of cereal (honey nut cheerios) and sausages. ElâAir approves.

Hands down the closest alternative to what might be described as the nectar of the gods. The aroma outstandingly displays the contrast between bitterness and a fruity finish, blended to perfection with an aftertaste of top tier single malt whiskey (along the lines of Highland Park). The taste might be overwhelming at first but after a few sips, youâll find yourself charmed by its complexity. A true brutal beer for those who seek an exotic kick to the nuts topped with a kiss. #somenextlevelshit #respect
